context.title: Future of Europe
context.subtitle: Citizen survey results
context.description: ​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​The Future of Europe survey has been created by the European Committee of the Regions to find out what people think about the European Union, its role, function and its future challenges.    The survey is available in all official EU languages, and is completely anonymous.

contentnav.text: Your views on the future of Europe

questions.question: In your opinion, what are the main problems of your city or region?

responses.text: Climate change and other environmental issues
Freedom of expression and rule of law

questions.question: If no, how should european countries show more solidarity?

questions.question: What level of politics do you think you can rely on most?
Do you think there is enough solidarity between European countries?
How should Europen Countries show more solidarity?

responses.text: By reducing inequalities between richer and poorer countries and regions
By jointly tackling major health-related crises such as the COVID-19 pandemic
By facing together the consequences of migratory flows and the refugee crisis
By jointly tackling the negative impact of the economic and financial crisis
By defining a common approach to climate change and environmental challenges
By showing greater acceptance of the diversities that exist among the different countries
